text: <@U08C22VNW|mhouston> has joined the channel
<@U08DDG1SB|brian> has joined the channel
<@U08E2KZM4|genevayngrib> has joined the channel

a lot of work on this subject was done by FileCoin, StorJ, MaidSafe people. Tradle team needed something different, not a generic file storage, but an extension to bitcoin transactions. This way blockchain + this special transactional storage would work more like a DB log. Here is our thoughts on the subject of incentives: <https://github.com/tradle/about/wiki/Bitkeeper-incentives>

attachments.title: tradle/about
attachments.text: about - This is a place for Tradle docs

text: <@U08ERPTQF|paul_xbt> has joined the channel
<@U07GDL0H5|ryanxcharles> has joined the channel
<@U08E2KZM4>: Bitkeeper is very interesting, especially for our use case where the files themselves aren't private - think distributed Imgur :simple_smile:
but we come back to the CP issue and keepers not knowing when they are storing content deemed illegal in their jurisdiction
<@U08ERPTQF>: CP issue?
gosh i wish we had another type of illegal content to talk about so we didn't have to bring up CP all the time
this is like every conversation about bitcoin ... "but what about CP, terrorism, and money laundering ??" everyone always asks
I think the issue of some jurisdictions making it a  felony to keep some types of media on your disk was discussed on Aether at some point.
...not to dismiss the subject. obviously it is important.
One idea was for unencrypted content to be censored be each node that wants to protect itself
forgive my ignorance - what does CP stand for? content porn?
CP = child porn
of course :simple_smile:
<@U08ERPTQF>: I thought the decision was made to only store the textual data, so it is much less of an issue. I understand that people can still use all of sorts of encoding for images.
Yes text data is the primary scope, but image data has it's uses (such as a header image for a post a la Medium) but not essential
the other consideration was obfuscating  data with a light encryption to give plausible deniability to anyone who inadvertently kept the content - IMO this is easier than filtering
light encryption I suppose would give deniability for downloading, but then filtering must be applied to remove questionable content from the node’s  storage
